user.description:
Setup your Better Thermostat to integrate with Home Assistant
**If you need more info: https://better-thermostat.org/configuration#first-step**

data.name: Name
data.off_temperature: The outdoor temperature when the thermostat turns off
data.tolerance: Tolerance, to prevent the thermostat from turning on and off too often.
data.window_off_delay: Delay before the thermostat turns off when the window is opened
data.window_off_delay_after: Delay before the thermostat turns on when the window is closed
data.outdoor_sensor: If you have an outdoor sensor, you can use it to get the outdoor temperature
data.weather: Your weather entity to get the outdoor temperature

data_description.presets: Select the presets you want to be available for this thermostat.

data.heat_auto_swapped: If the auto means heat for your TRV and you want to swap it
data.child_lock: Ignore all inputs on the TRV like a child lock
data.homematicip: If you use HomematicIP, you should enable this to slow down the requests to prevent the duty cycle
data.valve_maintenance: If your thermostat has no own maintenance mode, you can use this one
data.no_off_system_mode: If your TRV can't handle the off mode, you can enable this to use target temperature 5°C instead

data_description.protect_overheating: Some TRVs don't close the valve completely when the temperature is reached. Or the radiator has a lot of rest heat. This can cause overheating. This option can prevent this.
data_description.calibration_mode:
The kind how the calibration should be calculated
***Normal***: In this mode, the TRV internal temperature sensor is fixed by the external temperature sensor.
***Aggressive***: In this mode, the TRV internal temperature sensor is fixed by the external temperature sensor but set much lower/higher to get a quicker boost.
***AI Time Based***: In this mode, the TRV internal temperature sensor is fixed by the external temperature sensor, but a custom algorithm calculates the value to improve the TRV internal algorithm.
***MPC Predictive***: Uses the MPC predictive controller to derive a valve opening and converts it to offsets or setpoints when direct valve control is unavailable.
***PID Controller***: Uses a PID controller to dynamically adjust valve position based on temperature error, proportional term, integral accumulation, and derivative prediction.
***TPI Controller***: Uses a Time Proportional Integral controller for stable and precise temperature control over time.
data_description.calibration:
How the calibration should be applied on the TRV (Target temp or offset)
***Target Temperature Based***: Apply the calibration to the target temperature.
***Offset Based***: Apply the calibration to the offset.

confirm.title: Confirm adding a Better Thermostat
confirm.description:
You are about to add `{name}` to Home Assistant.
With {trv} as the real Thermostat

error.no_off_mode:
Your device is very special and has no off mode :(
Better Thermostat will use the minimal target temp instead.
error.no_outside_temp: You have no outside temperature sensor. Better Thermostat will use the weather entity instead.

abort.single_instance_allowed: Only a single Thermostat for each real is allowed.
abort.no_devices_found: No thermostat entity found, make sure you have a climate entity in your home assistant

confirm.title: The related entity {entity} is missing
confirm.description:
The reason for this is that the entity ({entity}) is not available in your Home Assistant.

You can fix this by checking if the battery of the device is full or reconnecting it to HA. Make sure that the entity is back in HA before you continue.
